Jeg giver ikke Facebook eller nogen andre enheder, associerede med Facebook tilladelse til at bruge mine billeder, mine informationer, meddelelser eller tjenester, bÃ¥de tidligere og kommende. Med denne udtalelse meddeler jeg Facebook, at det er strengt forbudt at udlÃ¥ne, kopiere, distribuere eller fordele andre opslag fra min profil og dens indhold. Indholdet i denne profil er privat og af konfidentiel informativ art. KrÃ¦nkningen af privatlivets fred kan straffes alene vha. gÃ¦ldende dansk lov og retspraksis. ForstÃ¥ at: Facebook nu er en offentlig institution. Alle medlemmer skal skrive en meddelelse som denne. Hvis du vil, kan du kopiere og indsÃ¦tte den i denne version. Jeg vil dog gerne vÃ¦lge for mig selv, sÃ¥ jeg beder jer alle om en lille tjeneste - hvis de lÃ¦ser dette brev, sÃ¥ giv mig en hurtig kommentar, et "hallo", et klistermÃ¦rke, hvad end du vil, sÃ¥ du vil blive vist i min Nyheder i nyheder â¼ á¢ Ellers vÃ¦lger facebook, hvem der skal vise mig, og jeg har ikke brug for facebook til at vÃ¦lge mine venner! Hold din finger nede hvor som helst i dette opslag, og "kopi" vil dukke op. 2014 med mere omsorg og glÃ¦de. Hvem kommer fÃ¸rst? Jeg deltager i Pay-it-forward initiativet. De fÃ¸rste fem mennesker, der kommenterer pÃ¥ denne status med "jeg er med", vil modtage en overraskelse fra mig pÃ¥ et eller andet tidspunkt i kalenderÃ¥ret. Vi vil gerne invitere til fernisering i Officinet pÃ¥ vores nye udstilling: Effektiv Spild af tid -Klassiske kvindelige sysler i moderne og eksperimenterende kontekst.  Med udstillingen sÃ¦tter vi fokus pÃ¥ vÃ¦rdien af fordybelse og bryder med den klassiske opfattelse af strik, filt, vÃ¦vning og syning.  âVi lever i en tid, hvor de varer vi omgiver os med, som oftest er produceret langt vÃ¦k fra vores egne hÃ¦nder. Tidligere tiders viden om hÃ¥ndvÃ¦rk forsvinder. Der er krav om effektivisering pÃ¥ alle niveauer i vores samfund, men man taler ikke om vÃ¦rdien af fordybelsen. Vores Ã¦rinde er at sÃ¦tte fokus pÃ¥ vÃ¦rdien af at give tid, fordybe sig og lege, fordi det ulÃ¸seligt hÃ¦nger sammen med at udvikle, tÃ¦nke nye tanker og finde pÃ¥ nye og alternative lÃ¸sninger.â â Effektiv Spild af Tid.  Gruppen udforsker traditionelle kvindelige hÃ¥ndarbejdsteknikker og bruger dem pÃ¥ nye mÃ¥der og i nye udtryksformer. Strikning, filtning, vÃ¦vning og syning er teknikker, der traditionelt er knyttet til kvindehÃ¥ndvÃ¦rk og husflid. HÃ¥ndvÃ¦rket har haft en praktisk funktion i husholdningen, men rent kunstnerisk, har det ikke haft den store anseelse i samfundet.  De Bedste Hilsner  Astrid Skibsted, Julie Bach, Maya Rosette og Stine Leth

Det er svÃ¦rt at vide, om der stÃ¥r inkompetence eller sÃ¦rlig snedighed bag dette indgreb over for humaniora, men embedsmÃ¦ndene er i hvert fald nÃ¥et frem til en djÃ¦velsk model. Og sÃ¥ sÃ¦lger Ministeriet tilmed modellen ved bevidst at skrÃ¦mme med dimittend-arbejdslÃ¸shedstal fra en begrÃ¦nset tidsperiode Ã¥r tilbage â og ikke den generelle, nuvÃ¦rende arbejdslÃ¸shed pÃ¥ storfaget engelsk, hvor der nÃ¦sten er fuld beskÃ¦ftigelseâ, siger institutleder JÃ¸rn Boisen fra KUs ENGEROM (Engelsk, Germansk og Romansk).  Institutlederen stiller med det seneste eksempel pÃ¥, at Uddannelsesministerens dimensioneringsindgreb er en teknokratisk regnearks-Ã¸velse. For instituttet lander pÃ¥ ministeriets dÃ¸dsliste pÃ¥ en unuanceret regnemetode:  âModellen blander store og smÃ¥ fag med vidt forskellige beskÃ¦ftigelsesmÃ¸nstre. At slÃ¥ store og mellemstore sprogfag som engelsk, tysk, spansk og fransk sammen med mindre fag som semitisk, hvor 4 arbejdslÃ¸se kandidater fx giver en hÃ¸j arbejdslÃ¸shedsprocent pÃ¥ 30, betyder negativt, at hele vores institut kommer pÃ¥ ministeriets âdÃ¸dslisteâ.  PÃ¥ embedsmÃ¦ndenes unuancerede xl-ark rammes instituttet derfor af den hÃ¥rdeste straf â 30 pctâs dimensionering. Og det selv om instituttets store og mellemstore fag (fx engelsk, tysk, spansk og fransk) har lille og tilmed faldende arbejdslÃ¸shed.â, forklarer han. âHvis modellen var nuanceret vÃ¦gtet i forhold til antallet af kandidater og i forhold til fagenes aktuelle beskÃ¦ftigelse, ville vores institut IKKE komme pÃ¥ ministeriets dÃ¸dslisteâ.  Nu er institutlederen stillet overfor at skulle skÃ¦re 30 pct. pÃ¥ kandidaten, dvs. fra 144 (2014) til 100: âOg optaget pÃ¥ ba-trinnet skal sÃ¥ tilsvarende nedjusteres, og det fÃ¥r drastiske konsekvenser, for et realistisk skÃ¸n vil betyde en reduktion af BA-optaget til 120 for alle de store sprogfag, eftersom alle, der starter, har et retskrav til at starte pÃ¥ en KA-uddannelse. Instituttets Ã¸konomi kan blive reduceret til en tredjedel med alvorlige konsekvenser for bemanding, fagbredden og kvalitet i undervisningenâ, forklarer han. âModellen er unuanceret og absurd. Men teknisk set kan instituttet opstille tre lige ubehagelige mÃ¥der at skÃ¦re pÃ¥:  - En grÃ¸nthÃ¸ster, hvor alle fag reduceres til en tredjedel.   - Fag med optag under 10-15 kandidater Ã¥rligt nedlÃ¦gges. Disse fag vil det tage Ã¥r at genopbygge senere.   - Der nedlÃ¦gges en stÃ¸rre eller mindre del af engelsk-studiet, fordi det vil batte noget i reduktionen af studiepladserne â men engelsk er verdensproget, og der er fuld beskÃ¦ftigelse i faget, sÃ¥ det ville vÃ¦re fuldkommen absurdâ. Participatory cultures, institutions, methods  PhD course at Aarhus University April 12-15, 2016.  The goal of this PhD course is to strengthen the practical and theoretical insight in different forms of participation and thereby to qualify our understanding of the significance, opportunities and limits of contemporary participatory culture.  Keynotes and workshops facilitators will be international and Aarhus scholars working on participatory culture: Noortje Marres, Goldsmiths; Nico Carpentier, Uppsala University; Leila Jancovich, Leeds Beckett University and Carsten Stage, Camilla MÃ¸hring Reestorff, Louise Ejgod and Birgit Eriksson, all Aarhus University.  Deadline is soon: 1 Feb. 2016  Read more here:  https://phdcourses.dk/Course/43771#.Vp9jN6N7y70

@[1387113031:2048:Carsten Stage], @[843760647:2048:Camilla MÃ¸hring Reestorff] and I have the last year or so been working on a projects about citizen participation in European cultural centres. We've collaborated with 20 "citizen scientists" from the cultural centres, Kulturhusene i Danmark (KHiD) and European Network of Cultural Centres (ENCC) - thus having participation as both object and method. Look forward to presenting and discussing the participatory methods and results at Godsbanen, Aarhus, 17-19 May.

Across Europe, cultural centers engage citizens in a variety of artistic and social activities. But what kinds of participatory and civic dynamics are created? This has been investigated in RECcORD, a European collaborative research and action project that Carsten Stage, Camilla MÃ¸hring Reestorff and I have had a lot of fun (and work) with in the last couple of years. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MVKkaI6psdk&sns=em

Keynotes are Shannon Jackson, JosÃ© van Dijck and Lisanne Gibson. The conference takes place in Aarhus 18-20 April. I promise it will be eye-opening, thought-provoking and fun. Hope to see you there. Happy and proud to contribute to this book about a writer and academic who has meant a lot to me becoming one. Sad that he's not around any more to make our world brighter, wiser, more reasonable and fun. The contributions in the book all take their point of departure in one quote from Eco. Mine is this: "William was not at all interested in the truth, which is nothing but the adjustment between the thing and the intellect. On the contrary, he amused himself by imagining how many possibilities were possible".

Dear all Want to continue some of the great discussions and fun we had at the Cultures of Participation conference in Aarhus - and/or know more about everyday participation? Then join @[1357562049:2048:Anne Scott SÃ¸rensen] and me to Manchester:  Understanding everyday participation: Re-locating culture, value and inequality 11-12 June, 2018 Friendsâ Meeting House, Manchester  The Understanding Everyday Participation â Articulating Cultural Values project calls into question the traditional boundaries of âcultureâ and exposes the role these play in the making of economic, social and geographical inequalities. Its research disputes the methodological nationalism that dominates understandings of cultural participation and demands a radical re-appraisal of the meanings and stakes attached to participation and âcultural valueâ.  This closing project conference asks how we might re-think the field of participation studies, both within and across disciplinary boundaries, including its articulations with policy.  Confirmed keynote speakers: Professor Omar Lizardo (University of Notre Dame) and Professor Kate Oakley (University of Leeds)  http://www.everydayparticipation.org/

Nyt forsknings- og udviklingsprojekt om deltagerkultur i Danmark Louise Ejgod Hansen og jeg har sammen med Kulturhusene i Danmark (KHiD) udviklet et nyt forsknings- og udviklingsprojekt om deltagelse i kulturhuse/institutioner i DK (stÃ¸ttet af Nordea Fonden). Vi har ansat en ph.d.-studerende (Karen Nordentoft), og der er nu Ã¥bent for ansÃ¸gninger fra kulturhuse/institutioner, som har lyst til at vÃ¦re med. Det er en oplagt mulighed for alle kulturinstitutioner, der gerne vil videreudvikle viden og praksis om/for/med deltagelse. AnsÃ¸gningsfrist 1. okt.  Lidt om projektet: DELTAG er et nytÃ¦nkende projekt, der aktivt udvikler og undersÃ¸ger kulturhuse og andre borgerinvolverende kulturinstitutioner i Danmark ved at skabe og dele viden pÃ¥ omrÃ¥det. Mennesker med stÃ¦rke tilknytninger til det lokale kulturliv i hele landet samarbejder med et lille forskerteam om at indsamle og udvikle ny viden om aktiviteter og deltagelesformer i borgerinvolverende kulturinstitutioner i Danmark. DELTAG projektet bÃ¥de undersÃ¸ger hvad deltagelse er og anvender aktiv deltagelse som metode. I den proces fÃ¥r op til 35 aktivt deltagende huse/institutioner nye vÃ¦rktÃ¸jer til at undersÃ¸ge deres egne aktiviteter og til at skabe nye faglige netvÃ¦rk og ny viden om deltagelse, udvikling og engagement i lokalsamfundet. Mere her - og del gerne: http://www.kulturhusene.dk/aktiviteter/deltag-projekt?fbclid=IwAR1iF5Y1xBqbxdsm4JYi9zXrWv0jATkPb9VItzqIsdyNW6T3WQ8Cbq0AOFg

Very happy that our edited collection, Cultures of Participation, is now out. The book examines cultural participation from three different, but interrelated perspectives: participatory art and aesthetics; participatory digital media, and participatory cultural policies and institutions. The book is one of the results of the work we've been doing in the TAKE PART-network in the last years. Thank you so much to everyone who have contributed to the network activities and the book. And a special TAK to Carsten Stage and Bjarki Valtysson for sharing the challenges and joys of co-editing :-). Sorry about the prize of the book but there's an e-book as well...  https://www.routledge.com/Cultures-of-Participation-Arts-Digital-Media-and-Cultural-Institutions/Eriksson-Stage-Valtysson/p/book/9780429266454

Dear colleagues, these past months COVID-19 crisis has impacted us all. We hope you are well and healthy, and have managed to organize your life in order to answer challenges of these difficult times. The situation has affected our plans and activities too but we have finally managed to publish video materials from the "The Age of Cultural Participation: Democratic Roles and Consequences" seminar held in Zagreb from 7th to 8th November 2019. Recordings of keynote speeches, panel sessions and discussions are now available at Kultura Nova YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLTG3mt9FRDzm3VGjus2l9csFImoldNADk We encourage you to disseminate recordings through your channels. Thank you again for your valuable contribution to the seminar. Hopefully we will have opportunity to collaborate and meet again in our near future. Our thoughts remain with all those who have been affected by this global crisis but we hope that with we will come out of it more resilient. Best regards, Tamara Zamelli Head of Research and Development Department "Kultura nova" Gajeva 2/6, 10 000 Zagreb t: +385 1 553 27 78 e: tamara.zamelli@kulturanova.hr

Om et par uger taler jeg pÃ¥ nedenstÃ¥ende Ã¥bne seminar:  The Participation Research Group at the University of Leeds invite you to discuss new research on the Civic Role of the Arts from Engand and Denmark.  To be held on Monday 29th November from 2.30-4pm online on Zoom.  Please book at the following link https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/civic-role-of-the-arts-invitation-to-discussion-tickets-205621789307  The session will be chaired by Leo Burtin, PhD candidate in the School of Performance and Cultural Industries at the University of Leeds and will include the following presentations  Helen Nicholson (Professor of theatre and performance at Royal Holloway, University of London) will introduce her current AHRC-funded research project, Civic Theatres: A Place for Towns. The research is being undertaken in collaboration with Professor Jenny Hughes (Univeristy of Manchester) and investigates amateur, professional, community and civic theatres in towns across England (https://creativetownsresearch.wordpress.com). Helen's previous research specialises in cultural participation and theatre in community settings and includes research into amateur theatre (with Nadine Holdsworth and Jane Milling),   Birgit Eriksson (Professor of cultural theory and analysis in the Department of Aesthetics and Culture, Aarhus University) specialises in participatory arts and culture, the uses of the arts, and aesthetics and politics. Birgit will share findings from the research project:âArt and social communities in Danish social housing areasâ (2019-22). She is also engaged in research projects on âParticipate: Citizen participation in Danish cultural centersâ(2019-22), and âCraftWork: Creative, institutional and social potentials in new forms of participation at art museumsâ(2021-24), and co-directing a research program on Cultural Transformations http://cc.au.dk/en/research/research-programmes/cultural-transformations/.  All welcome, so please share with your networks!  And to find out more about the Participation Research group in the School of Performance and Cultural Industries visit (https://ahc.leeds.ac.uk/performance-research-innovation/doc/participation-research-group)

Here's a bit about us: My husband Graeme and I will be moving to Aarhus in September 2014 for 2.5 years, and are looking for accommodation in Aarhus, close to or south of the city center. We are both from Vancouver and have spent the last several years living in California. Natalie will be a PhD researcher at Aarhus University's Department of Culture and Society, working on an interdisciplinary project that brings together biology and anthropology to consider human altered landscapes (see http://anthropocene.au.dk/). Graeme is a software and web-developer and will be looking for contract or full-time work with technology start-ups in Aarhus. We are avid cyclists and enjoy the outdoors (camping, swimming, hiking, sailing, kayaking, skiing, etc.). We are excited to immerse ourselves in Danish life and culture, and are looking to live in an interesting and central neighborhood, for a furnished or unfurnished apartment, one or two bedrooms, somewhere in the range of 12 000 DKK per month.

Written two books on Palliative Care:  THE BOOK: Integrating a Palliative Approach: Essentials for Personal Support Workers  WORKBOOK: Integrating a Palliative Approach: Essentials for Personal Support Workers Read more about these two amazing books here:  http://www.lifeanddeathmatters.ca/new-psw-text-and-workbook I have looked through it and so much of it touches home, sepecially these days, when two years ago, we were all caring for my Mum at home while she died. And it would have been excellent to have when I worked as a nurses aid (sygehjÃ¦lper) with older people.   The book is getting the best recommendations from top palliative experts around the world.     Have a look  at the great site and a little peak at the pictures.

Disse henvendelser kalder man typisk 'Nigeria'-henvendelser - Hvis man indleder en dialog med dem, ender det som regel med, at man modtager et falsk bevis for, at de har overfÃ¸rt pengene til ens konto via en anerkendt bank ell. Western Union. Hvis man afsender varen, modtager man aldrig efterfÃ¸lgende betalingen. Dette er alt sammen lavet meget professionelt og cirkulerer desvÃ¦rre mange steder pÃ¥ nettet.   Du kan lÃ¦se mere om disse falske PayPal-kvitteringer i vores Sikkerhedscenter: http://sikkerhed.dba.dk/artikler/falske-paypal-kvitteringer/  Heldigvis er det kun en meget lille del af henvendelserne som nÃ¥r igennem til vores site. NÃ¥r dette sker, bliver vi dog straks alarmeret og disse henvendelser stoppes hurtigt herfra. Dette er ogsÃ¥ allerede sket for personen, som har kontaktet dig.  Vi arbejder konstant pÃ¥ forbedringer af disse filtrer. Disse svindlere er dog meget dygtige til det de gÃ¸r, og derfor er det desvÃ¦rre ikke muligt blot at blokere pÃ¥ ip-adresser fra f.eks. Nigeria. De generer blot dynamiske ip-adresser, som kommer fra andre lande â F.eks danske ip-adresser.   Kendetegn for disse typer henvendelser er: Henvendelsen er ofte pÃ¥ engelsk eller et meget dÃ¥rligt dansk, der bÃ¦rer prÃ¦g af at vÃ¦re oversat i Google Translate Varen skal altid sendes til udlandet Pas pÃ¥ hvis kÃ¸ber hÃ¦vder at have indbetalt for meget til f.eks. transport og efterfÃ¸lgende beder dig tilbagebetale restbelÃ¸bet Ãnsker varen sendt straks og sender kvitteringer pÃ¥ at pengene er overfÃ¸rt â Disse kvitteringer er falske. Du bÃ¸r derfor aldrig sende varen fÃ¸r du kan se at pengene er indgÃ¥et pÃ¥ din bankkonto Ved sms-henvendelser vil der typisk ikke vÃ¦re noget afsendernummer oplyst, men kun en e-mailadresse som du skal skrive til Disse henvendelser kan komme bÃ¥de pÃ¥ mail og via sms.  Hold dig lÃ¸bende orienteret i vores Sikkerhedscenter, hvor vi ogsÃ¥ giver dig gode rÃ¥d til en sikker handel: http://sikkerhed.dba.dk/  Denne afsender er naturligvis blokeret pÃ¥ DBA - Oplever du igen mistÃ¦nkelig adfÃ¦rd, eller er du i tvivl om en kÃ¸ber er reel, sÃ¥ kontakt mig.

Mount Baker (behind the American juan de fuca gulf islands in the  Usa), stands up like a sugar top, popping up when you are on the ferry, or here, in the evening, driving through the stunning farmlands from Saanich to Victoria.  There are beaches surrounding Victoria, this one is accessible from Island view road, driving between the ferry â´ at Swartz Bay, to Victoria.  And happens to be where sister Kath Murray and Ted live, not far from Michell farms.  I the city, the fairytale parliament buildings light up the harbor area and look like a fairy tale. They are right beside the proud Empress Hotel that unfortunately has been 'restored' and lost its charm and old beauty. So no photos of that.  A favorite place. Victoria. These tests are in preparation for my Danish citizenship exam, i am taking with all the other hopeful foreigners, on November 30, 2017.  I have to get 34 out of 40 correct.  To be honest, I have never been so unsure of whether I will pass or not.  No. I will pass!!!  Why am I doing this?  Because I feel like a Dane and want to be able to vote at the government elections in the country I have spent two- thirds of my life:). I have not been able to vote in canada while I live here.   And also because it is now possible to become a danish citizen AND keep my Canadian citizenship. I have been here for forty-two years and have been waiting for this possibility.   I must say that if I knew that I had to study so much to start getting even average results, that I would never have started.   Now I have begun, have paid almost 400 dollars, used many hours studying, well, of course I will finish it.   These are links to the tests that I have been taking daily. A company has made an online studying forum, and one of their products is these daily test, to drill us through the 178 page book.

In support of mental illness. Maybe if people's heads weren't buried in the sand of ignorance and they took the time to understand, instead of judging and thinking it won't happen to them because they have the perfect family, life would be a little bit easier for people that do experience this! This hits close to home for me, for family and friends who live under this shadow. The days of 'it' not being talked about or being taboo should be over. In the most difficult moments of life you realize who your true friends are, and the people who really appreciate you. Unfortunately, most social media 'friends' aren't true friends. They will send you a "like" here and there, but in reality they do not take time to read your status if they see it's lengthy. More than half will stop reading right here, or have already scrolled on to the next post on their page. I decided to post this message in support of all those who continue to battle with their mental illness. Now, let's see who will have taken the time to read this lengthy post right through to the end. If you have read everything so far, please "like" it so that I can put a thank you on your page. More mental health awareness is urgently needed. Just because you can't see it, doesn't mean people aren't suffering. Please, try to spare a little of your time with someone who may just want to talk (about anything). Talking can help us all to cope a little more, keeping things bottled up just makes it worse. Most people will say, "if you need anything, don't hesitate to call me, I'll be there to help you" but will they? I believe a select few of my friends will post this, to show their support for those who may be struggling. You just have to copy and paste rather than sharing. I'd like to know who will take a minute out of their day to read this all the way to the end and then copy and paste it to their page, will you? If so, please write "done" in the comments.

Do Not Stand At My Grave And Weep By Mary Elizabeth Frye  Do not stand at my grave and weep I am not there; I do not sleep. I am a thousand winds that blow, I am the diamond glints on snow, I am the sun on ripened grain, I am the gentle autumn rain. When you awaken in the morning's hush I am the swift uplifting rush Of quiet birds in circled flight.  I am the soft stars that shine at night.  Do not stand at my grave and cry,  I am not there; I did not die.  Source: https://www.familyfriendpoems.com/poem/do-not-stand-by-my-grave-and-weep-by-mary-elizabeth-frye

1500 mink farms in Denmark have been ordered to slaughter all of their mink, because of the mutant COVID 19 - cluster 5. It is not reacting to the antidrugs in the same way that the COVID 19 does, meaning it will be resistant to the new vaccines.   These farms  produce approximately 17 million mink skins every year. The largest mink producent country in the world.   They will close all production of minks, probably for the coming many years.300 thousand people will be restricted, schools, public transportation will close.   So sad for so many people.  People who have worked to make the best mink in the world, and have done so for generations.   So good that the danish government is taking this new situation very seriously.  Whatever one thinks about minks- doesnât matter. There are so many people whose lives are drastically changed  by this.

Jeg har deltaget i Vejle Museum (give) borgerinddraget broderi projekt. Genforenings jubilÃ¦um (med forsinkelse).  (For you english speaking people  https://da.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genforeningen_i_1920 maybe there is a translation?)  Temaet er âgrÃ¦nserâ. Vi fik udleveret en sekskant af en gammel dug. Der var en blid farvepalet som vi mÃ¥tte bruge. Og ellers frie hÃ¦nder.  Alle sekskanter skal syes sammen til en lang dug. Der er ca. 44 emner indleveret.   Her er mit bidrag i billede og tilhÃ¸rende tekst. ï¿¼  GrÃ¦nser! Med en barndom i Canada, et voksent liv i danmark, har jeg krydset grÃ¦nser mange gange.  Der var en skat i midten, som jeg Ã¸nskede at komme hjem til.   Der kom andre skatter til, nye grÃ¦nser.  Jeg har krydset grÃ¦nsen mellem Canada og USA mange gange, og altid vÃ¦ret lettet over at mit hjem var Canada og ikke USA.   Der var jerntÃ¦ppet, grÃ¦nsen til Ungarn som vi krydsede i 1969, da jeg var 14. Her oplev jeg pigtrÃ¥d og maskinegevÃ¦r og mange bomme som gik ned, da vi kÃ¸rte forbi i vores VW campingvogn.   Der var Berlinmuren, som vi har vÃ¦ret nabo til i Danmark, og pigtrÃ¥den som holdt folket inde. Og holdt andre ude.og som kostede mange menneskeliv.    Der var grÃ¦nsen mellem Israel og Egypten, som vi krydsede da vi skulle pÃ¥ dykkerferie, det blÃ¥ hav og den rÃ¸de Ã¸rken. Og en grÃ¦nse med barske vagter sÃ¥ langt Ã¸jet rakte.   Der var grÃ¦nser som min bedstefar kÃ¦mpede for i WW1. Han blev skudt og mistede det ene Ã¸je, og lÃ¥ i flere dage i ingenmandsland, indtil tyskerne fandt ham og tog ham til sig.   Der er grÃ¦nser som bliver overtrÃ¥dt mellem mennesker.   Der er mange andre grÃ¦nser.   PÃ¥ den ene side, pÃ¥ den anden side.  Vi lukker ude og vi Ã¥bner os op. Vi gemmer det bedste allerinderste.   Mit broderi er en abstraktion af disse tanker.

â¤ (anon) Not my photo or words, but definitely my sentiments    WHERE IS THE LOVE? Family not invited to Christmas. Church members disassociate with other church members. Community members gossiping about others. Neighbors telling on neighbors. Businesses doing good in their communities, feeding their families and trying their best, and getting reported. Loyal hardworking and dedicated employees fired for personal choices. Kids are being told they can't play with other kids. Parents are unable to walk their 8-year-olds into dance practice or sit and watch them, while others do and don't even think twice about those who can't. Some people are unable to attend work Christmas parties while their employees gather and say cheers. Children are afraid to go to school because they may have to cough and they don't want to cough or they'll get sent home. People are being denied entry to some grocery stores in our very own country. People are being denied medical care for their choices. People dying because they can't get necessary surgeries. People dying alone. Seniors are locked up tighter than criminals. I don't recognize our world anymore. In two years, I live in a country I don't even know. Regardless of your choices (and honestly I don't care which one you made nor do I wish to hear your opinion either way because I really don't care either way). What I do care about is HOW WE ARE TREATING ONE ANOTHER BASED ON THOSE CHOICES. Think you're better than someone because you made a different choice? Think again. We are all humans sharing the exact same planet. Not one of us is better than another. But the superiority is so thick, I'm nauseous. What I'm saying here is you don't have to be pro or anti-anything to use the logic that LOVE is lost. It's time to see reality..... THE FEAR IS THICK THE GOSSIP IS THICK THE ANGER IS THICK AND THICKEST OF ALL  IS THE HATRED 'In it together  Was quickly replaced withâ¦ âTogether only if you made the right choiceâ As the divide expands. My only answer to bridging the gap is LOVE Don't think love will get us out? I'd love to know what will because so far the lack of love has dug us a trench so deep I wonder if we'll ever be able to jump over it. How a needle and a virus showed the world and each human in it what was already inside of them all along. Because true colors come out when people are squeezed. And as the squeezing continues. And so many people spew hatred. At people they once said they loved unconditionally - that means without condition (I'll love you no matter what you do or say or choose - that's what real love is folks) I ask the questions... WILL YOU BE PROUD OF YOURSELF after this? Will you walk away with integrity? Knowing you were KIND regardless of medical status? There are so many things I could list that I want. But truthfully? All I want for Christmas is LOVE.

Arrived well in Minnesota, USA!!!!!
Everything is fine and BIG in USA! Det halve af dagen er gaaet med at blive vist rundt paa[ farmen her, og 11 traktorer blev sat paa rad og raekke - til aere for os her til aften!!
der kommer flere billeder, men det tager ekstremt lang tid at oploade!
har vaeret til Owatanna Fair. En blanding af dyrskue, udstilling, marked og goegl. Og lidt shopping....  Fik en "lille" regnbyge, mens vi var paa marked.
Har vaeret paa besoeg hos Darlene and Lester og ude at spise med dem. Et par forretninger naaede vi ogsaa!!
Fortsat alt vel her i Albert Lea, we are having a great time, really busy!
Det bliver stoerre og stoerre her!!!
Har vaeret paa tur til Missisippi River!
I gaar sondag var vi i kirke, hvor vi ogsaa fik frokost! I dag korer vi ud mod vest til South Dakota, vil vare tilbage her ca. lordag. Vil prove at tjekke mail og facebook undervejs, men ved ikke om det kan lade sig gore. Vore mobiler virker ikke herovre, men Hazels 587 383 4523 og Floyds 587 383 3211 kan benyttes, hvis der sker noget. Sa der gaar nok ca. en uge, inden der kommer nye fotos her paa Facebook!
Vi er p.t. i Deadwood, har lige besogt en guldmine. Har ogsaa se de fire ansigter og Crazy Horse. Vi oplever saa meget, at det er helt ubeskriveligt!!!  Saa mere information senere, vi er bare lige inde paa et bibliotek!!
Er vel tilbage i Albert LEa efter 6 dages tur ud i Black Hills. Det var helt fantastisk derude!!!
HAr taget en slapper-dag efter den store udflugt. Er ved at sortere fotos, saa der kan komme nogen her paa facebook.
Har fundet 4 af min mormors breve i dag herovre!!
Og saa har jeg fundet 2 af min morfars breve, fra 1946 og1957

Skal op til LEster og Darlene igen i dag
Har besogt Darlene i dag, Alle 4 soenner var der, samt 3 af bornebornene. Vi har fortsat saerdeles fint vejr.
Kufferterne er vist ved at vaere fulde!!  Fik ogsaa gaver i dag, saa maaske kommer det til at knibe med pladsen - vi har jo koebt "lidt" selv!
Har vaeret til traktor-show idag. MASSER af traktorer og varmt vejr. I morgen kommer der en masse og siger farvel, og mandag morgen - lokal tid - koerer vi til Minneapolis, saa kan vi naa verdens stoerste indkoebscenter, Mall of America  inden vi skal flyve!
saa er der nedtaelling til hjemturen. Darlene og Lester kommer ned til os i eftermiddag.
Sidder i lufthavnen i Minneapolis. Er tjekket ind! Saa indtil videre gaar hjemrejsen planmaessigt!!!!

This morning at five I took a 500 km drive round Denmark.  I went to Copenhagen airport to pick up my son who returned from his trip to China and Nepal. I brought him to a cottage in the countryside, where he will do his quarantine, before coming home. The anxiety of the pandemic, worries of the future and the relief and joy of having my son safely home were all together in one big mixture of feelings. The sunrise reminded me of the power of nature and comfort of beauty.

Med stor glÃ¦de kan jeg fortÃ¦lle, at jeg er blevet tildelt Tagea Brandts rejselegat 2020. Legatet blev oprettet i 1905 af fabrikant Vilhelm Brandt til minde om hans hustru, der dÃ¸de 35 Ã¥r gammel i 1882. Til de der er interesseret: Hvor meget underviser danske lÃ¦rere egentlig, og hvad fÃ¥r de i lÃ¸n?  Her er fakta om lÃ¦rernes lÃ¸n og arbejdstid   * En lÃ¦rers arbejdstid er i gennemsnit 37 timer om ugen eller 7,4 timer om dagen. Det dÃ¦kker dog over, at nogen uger er mere travle end andre. * Arbejdet tilrettelÃ¦gges normalt pÃ¥ hverdage, mandag til fredag, og maksimalt pÃ¥ 209 dage om Ã¥ret. Eleverne gÃ¥r i skole 200 dage om Ã¥ret. * Arbejdstiden i et skoleÃ¥r udgÃ¸r for fuldtidsansatte 1924 timer inklusiv ferie og helligdage. * LÃ¦rerne har fem ugers ferie + 6. ferieuge. Reelt er lÃ¦rernes arbejdstid dog indrettet sÃ¥dan, at de i mange uger arbejder mere end de 37 timer, mens de til gengÃ¦ld holder fri i skolernes ferier. * En del af ferien kan dog inddrages til for eksempel planlÃ¦gning og efteruddannelse. For eksempel fik samtlige kÃ¸benhavnske folkeskolelÃ¦rere inddraget noget af skolernes sommerferie sidste Ã¥r i forbindelse med obligatorisk efteruddannelse. * IfÃ¸lge KL's beregninger underviser en lÃ¦rer i gennemsnit 21,8 lektioner om ugen. * IfÃ¸lge Danmarks LÃ¦rerforening er gennemsnitstallet imidlertid ikke retvisende for den enkelte lÃ¦rers virkelighed, idet gennemsnitstallet ifÃ¸lge lÃ¦rerforeningen kan trÃ¦kkes meget ned af enkelte lÃ¦rere, der bruger arbejdsdagen som for eksempel undervisnings-vejledere eller skolebibliotekarer. LÃ¦rerforeningen vurderer, at en lÃ¦rer derfor typisk underviser 23-24 lektioner om ugen. * Danmarks LÃ¦rerforening har ikke beregninger for et gennemsnitligt undervisningstal, men anlÃ¦gger det synspunkt, at lÃ¦rerne med den nuvÃ¦rende arbejdstidsaftale som udgangspunkt underviser 25-26 lektioner med mindre skolelederen har bedt lÃ¦reren om at lÃ¸se andre opgaver. * En folkeskolelÃ¦rers gennemsnitslÃ¸n er 29.146 kroner. Hertil kommer 17,3 procent arbejdsgiverbetalt pension. Kilde: LÃ¦rernes Centralorganisation, KL, Danmarks LÃ¦rerforening /ritzau

SÃ¥ flot en nekrolog. Skakspiller Richardt Ebbesen. SÃ¥dan Ã¸nskede Richardt der skal stÃ¥ pÃ¥ hans gravsten.  Jeg ved hvor meget Springeren betÃ¸d for Richardt. Lis Ravn Ebbesen, Lindealle 18, skriver fÃ¸lgende mindeord om sin mand.  Skakspiller Richardt Ebbesen  SÃ¥dan sagde Richardt, der skulle stÃ¥ pÃ¥ hans gravsten. Men for mig var han sÃ¥ meget mere end skakspilleren. Min klippe, min sparringspartner, min livskammerat, kÃ¦rligheden i mit liv - han var alt for mig.  28.12.68 havde vi udset os den samme stol til bal pÃ¥ SÃ¸en i Vamdrup, hvorfor jeg kom til at sidde pÃ¥ skÃ¸det af ham. Den generte skakspiller og klubmester i Vamdrup Skakklub og jeg blev hinandens fÃ¸rste rigtige kÃ¦rester. Tre mÃ¥neder senere flyttede min familie til Christiansfeld, og mange var de breve, der blev skrevet, og knallertture Richardt tog.  Han blev fÃ¦rdiguddannet ved Schou Isenkram, og samme dag blev vi forlovet. Som de fleste dengang kom han ind som soldat i flyvevÃ¥bnet, da var uniformen flottest, syntes han. Men det blev et kort bekendtskab, da han blev kasseret pga. astma. Han syntes ikke, der var interessante job at fÃ¥, sÃ¥ vi besluttede at flytte til Kolding og sammen lÃ¦se videre. Richardt HG og jeg HF. Og Richardt indmeldte sig i Springeren. Som var arbejderskakklubben, sagde han.  Richardt blev sin families fÃ¸rste student. Uden det gjorde nogen forskel i hans livsindstilling eller gode og ligevÃ¦rdige kammeratlige forhold, han havde til sine to brÃ¸dre eller til de tre sÃ¸stre. Vi var blevet gift og efter knap et halvt Ã¥r ved Cola, for man gÃ¥r ikke arbejdslÃ¸s, var Richardts indstilling, blev Richardt ansat ved Brdr. Gram, som var flyttet til Kolding. Her mÃ¸dte han JÃ¸rgen og Erik, som sammen med deres koner livslangt blev vore venner.  Trine blev fÃ¸dt i 1976. Og Richardt holdt et helt Ã¥rs pause i Springeren. Richardt pÃ¥stod bÃ¸rn ikke sagde ham noget, fÃ¸r de blev mennesker. Man han kunne nu bÃ¥de skifte en ble og give en flaske. Brdr. Gram flyttede tilbage til Vojens, og Richardt flyttede med, men blev trÃ¦t af at sÃ¦lge kÃ¸leskabe, der ikke var pÃ¥ lager. Forsikringer var der derimod nok af pÃ¥ lager, mente han. Men de to Ã¥r ved Statsanstalten for livsforsikring var ingen stor succes. Salgstalerne gik fint. Richardt var rigtig god til at snakke med folk. Men nÃ¥r han sÃ¥ folks Ã¸konomi, kunne han ikke fÃ¥ sig selv til at slutte handlen.  Den dag Line blev fÃ¸dt i 81, var Richardt til samtale ved Aldi som indkÃ¸ber. Et job, han lagde mange timer i, de nÃ¦ste 32 Ã¥r. Da jeg kom i byrÃ¥det, blev det ham, der tog vare pÃ¥ pigernes fritid. PÃ¥ hytteture med fritidshjemmet og som chauffÃ¸r. Han holdt sjov med, at han var medlem af prins Henriks fanklub - de mÃ¦nd, der skulle gÃ¥ tre skridt bag deres koner. Men han var ikke fan af Henrik, fordi han syntes, mÃ¦nd burde vÃ¦re stolte af deres koner og bakke dem op. Det ansÃ¥ han for en stor svaghed ved mÃ¦nd, der ikke kunne.  I 95 dÃ¸de min mor og Richardts far med en dags mellemrum. Og vi blev enige om, at livet var for kort til at udsÃ¦tte alt til pensionisttilvÃ¦relsen og til at leve hver vores liv med politik og skak. SÃ¥ vi fik rengÃ¸ringshjÃ¦lp og tog pÃ¥ âDen Engelskeâ til livemusik, alle de lÃ¸rdage vi kunne. Typisk Richardt faldt han i snak med Sussi, en gang jeg ikke var med, og hun blev adgangsbilletten til Ludosupporterne - en gruppe af folkemusikelskere. SÃ¥ nu hed det ogsÃ¥ Strib, TÃ¸nder, Skagen festivaler og Festalligevel, hvor vi nÃ¸d deres selskab og venskab.  Det var en stolt far, der fulgte sine piger op ad kirkegulvet. Og han nÃ¸d familiemiddagene hver uge og mandesnakken og at kunne fÃ¥ Tomas og Line med til fodbold eller fÃ¦lles teaterture med Tomas som chauffÃ¸r. Vi blev berigede med to bÃ¸rnebÃ¸rn Alma og Asta, som Richardt tog pÃ¥ mange gÃ¥ture, cykelture og fisketure med. Og stak af med, nÃ¥r vi alle var i sommerhus forskellige steder i Danmark. Our russian guests from Creative Grasp has left Denmark again, bringing a lot of inspiration from Aarhus and Odense:  Ellen Riis and her student Johanne gave us a great insight  into the entrepreneurial learning as part of the film Education Multiplatform Storytelling and Production. Nick Jary introduced us to the action learning part of the Kaospilot Study. Aarhus Street Food opened  the doors  for meals and an interesting talk with Nikolaj Kirk from Hjerl Hede Open Air Museum. We continued to the craft community at Jaegergaardsgade 152, where we were introduced  by Lisbeth Solsoe, Julie Back, Ann Hoejgaard Slot from Heimkaer and Astrid Skibsted Holm. At night we went to Godsbanen. Friday we attended entrepreneuriel training at the Music Academy in Odense with our Star, Cecilia Krill. No wonder, if the hearts and minds are full. We will meet again in Arkhangelsk in December, and have created a lot of new and valuable connections in Denmark.

Jeg er i Ã¸jeblikket i gang med en coach uddannelse, og har, som en del af uddannelsen, brug for nogle personer (fokuspersoner) der kunne tÃ¦nke sig at blive coachet. Jeg skal foretage mindst 10 coaching-sessioner, og du kan godt blive coachet flere gange. D. 11/5 om eftermiddagen skal jeg til eksamen, og der har jeg brug for en fokusperson, der vil tage med mig.  At blive coachet adskiller sig fra terapi ved at vi i coachingen tager udgangspunkt i nuet og laver en fremadrettet handling, hvor terapi tager udgangspunkt i fortiden.   Det er dig der vÃ¦lger, hvad du vil snakke om. Og dermed kan vi snakke om alt.   TidsmÃ¦ssigt er der ingen ramme, det afhÃ¦nger af processen. Det kan tage mellem Â½ time og 3-4 timer. Til eksamen skal jeg kunne gÃ¸re det pÃ¥ Â½ time, men indtil videre er vi blevet instrueret i ikke at tage hensyn til tiden.  Hvis du vÃ¦lger at komme flere gange, er det dig der bestemmer om vi skal fortsÃ¦tte hvor vi slap sidste gang, eller om vi skal tage fat pÃ¥ et helt nyt emne.  Du har til enhver tid muligheden for at sige at du ikke Ã¸nsker at blive coachet mere, bÃ¥de fÃ¸r, undervejs i sessionen og efterfÃ¸lgende. Som fokusperson er det dig der bestemmer. I Tyskland er lÃ¸nniveauet nu blevet sÃ¥ lavt, at der er rigtig mange tyskere, som ikke kan fÃ¥ ender til at mÃ¸des - selvom de er i arbejde. Hvad kan vi gÃ¸re for at forsÃ¸ge at forhindre at dette sker?   Det kan vi ved at bakke op om de rigtige fagforeningers enormt vigtige arbejde. Jeg hÃ¥ber at I lytter til @[621303118:2048:Mattias Tesfaye] (selvom han er skiftet til socialdemokratiet) for han har fat i noget omkring working poor, og jeg hÃ¥ber at I tÃ¦nker jer godt om hvad det vil betyder for jer hver isÃ¦r, hvis vi mister den frie forhandlingsret. Til alle der interessere sig for konflikten mellem KL/corydon og Danmarks LÃ¦rerforening, er her en interessant (og lidt tung) artikel, som er tankevÃ¦kkende og skrÃ¦mmende.  Hvis jeg kort skal ridse op hvad jeg fik ud af at lÃ¦se denne artikel, sÃ¥ handler konflikten om reformen af skolen, ikke om lÃ¦rernes arbejdsforhold. Konflikten handler om begrebet New Management, hvor alle erhverv tÃ¦nkes som industrisamfund. Derfor snakker man om produtivitet, effektivisering og omsÃ¦tning.  I skole sammenhÃ¦ng betyder det, at for at kunne synliggÃ¸re effektiviseringen, skal man kunne mÃ¥le produktet. Det kan man gÃ¸re pÃ¥ karakterer og pÃ¥ hvor mange der gennemfÃ¸rer uddannelserne.  Men man kan ikke mÃ¥le pÃ¥ sociale kompetencer, konflikthÃ¥ndtering, anerkendelser og andre parameter, der danner mennesker. Derfor vil disse ting blive ekketiviseret vÃ¦k, under New Management-skolen.  Med New Management vender vi tilbage til kongerÃ¦kker, udenadslÃ¦rer og Den Gamle Skole.   I et videnssamfund virker det bagstrÃ¦berisk og besynderligt.  New Management forklarer ogsÃ¥ hvorfor ingen eksperter indenfor pÃ¦dagog, didaktik og psykologi bliver hÃ¸rt i denne konflikt. For det handler ikke om lÃ¦ring, mennesker og dannelse af borgere til et demokratisk samfund. Det handler om skolefabrikker og Ã¸konomi. Det forklarer mÃ¥ske ogsÃ¥ hvorfor det er finansministeren og ikke undervisningsministeren, der er den cemtrale person her.  Derfor kan man spÃ¸rge sig selv:  Hvilken borger vil du gerne have at dit barn bliver? Og hvilket samfund vil du gerne have at vores bÃ¸rn danner, nÃ¥r de bliver voksne, ansvarlige, myndige mennesker?  Det er lidt som med mobil-tjenester eller forsikringer: svarer prisen til produktet? Hvad er dit mÃ¥l for 2014?  Jeg mener ikke nytÃ¥rsforsÃ¦t, men mÃ¥l.  Hvis du er arbejdslÃ¸s, er det sikkert at fÃ¥ et job, ikk'? Og forhÃ¥bentligt skal det nok lykkes at nÃ¥ det mÃ¥l.  Det er min erfaring, at for at nÃ¥ et mÃ¥l er der mindst to ting der er vigtige:  - at sÃ¦tte mÃ¥l, der kan nÃ¥es, sÃ¥ det bliver en succesoplevelse - at lÃ¦gge en plan.  For at nÃ¥ et mÃ¥l kan det vÃ¦re en fordel at dele vejen til mÃ¥let op i delmÃ¥l.  Hvis fx mÃ¥let er et job, kan delmÃ¥let vÃ¦re at fÃ¥ en virksomhedspraktik, som har til formÃ¥l at skabe netvÃ¦rk, genoptrÃ¦ne fagsprog eller opkvalificere en komptence.   Hvis mÃ¥let med virksomhedspraktikken er at fÃ¥ et job, er du nÃ¦sten garanteret fiasko. Men hvis du vÃ¦lger at sÃ¦tte mÃ¥let, sÃ¥ det kan nÃ¥es, kan det blive en succesoplevelse, som sÃ¥ giver mere motivation og energi til videre jobsÃ¸gning.  Den anden del om at lÃ¦gge en plan handler ogsÃ¥ om at samle pÃ¥ successer - og kontrol.  SÃ¦t dig ned og lav en plan, hvor endelinjen er udlÃ¸b af dagpengeperioden (eller fx et Ã¥r fra nu, hvis du ikke lÃ¦ngere fÃ¥r dagpenge, eller kontanthjÃ¦lp).  Hvad skal der ske i den periode? HvornÃ¥r skal du nÃ¦ste gang aktiveres? Hvad vil du gerne, hvis du selv kan bestemme, bruge din aktivering pÃ¥?  Og sÃ¥ lÃ¦g tre planer. En plan, for hvordan du nÃ¥r frem til DRÃMMEJOBBET. En plan, for hvordan du nÃ¥r frem til et godt job, som du er OK med og En plan, for hvordan du fÃ¥r et smÃ¸r-pÃ¥-brÃ¸det job.  Hvilke veje er der du kan tage? Er der nogle kurser, der vil bringe dig tÃ¦ttere pÃ¥? Hvordan kan virksomhedspraktik/lÃ¸ntilskudsjob hjÃ¦lpe dig nÃ¦rmere et job?  NÃ¥r du sÃ¦tter succes-mÃ¥l og lÃ¦gger planer, vil du opleve en stÃ¸rre grad af motivation, stÃ¸rre fÃ¸lelse af kontrol med dit liv og en fÃ¸lelse af at kunne handle.  Og det er rart.  God planlÃ¦gning. Pludselig bliver man kontrolleret af fremmede folk i a-kasse og jobcenter, man bliver mÃ¸dt med krav som kan virke som om de kommer lige pludseligt og man mÃ¸der et meget omtalt begreb aktivering, som sjÃ¦ldent fÃ¥r rosende ord med pÃ¥ vejen. Den opfattes som en af grundpillerne i et velfungerende demokrati, fordi dette bygger pÃ¥ fri meningsudveksling. Desuden giver ytringsfrihed mulighed for at udtrykke afvigende meninger, sÃ¥ risikoen for at disse fÃ¥r et voldeligt udtryk mindskes.   Ytringsfriheden er isÃ¦r vigtig for mindretallene, idet de magthavende instanser pÃ¥ grund af deres magtposition ikke har reelt brug for beskyttelsen af retten til ytring. Den har nogle initiativer, som sÃ¦ttes i vÃ¦rk pr 1/1-15, og nogle ting der trÃ¦der i kraft pr 1/7-2015.  Og hvad betyder den sÃ¥ for dig, der er arbejdslÃ¸s og pÃ¥ dagpenge? â¢	FÃ¸rst og fremmest â og mest glÃ¦deligt â afskaffes gentagen aktivering. Det betyder at hvor man tidligere kunne opleve at komme pÃ¥ et jobsÃ¸gningskursus hos en aktÃ¸r, efterfulgt af et jobsÃ¸gningskursus hos en anden aktÃ¸r, efterfulgt af et jobsÃ¸gningskursus hos en tredje aktÃ¸r osv igennem hele ens ledighedsperiode, sÃ¥ har man som ledig nu RET og PLIGT til at deltage i Ã©t tilbud, som sÃ¥ kan suppleres med flere indsatser, hvis det er nÃ¸dvendig.   â¢	Den indsats man mÃ¸der skal vÃ¦re individuel, meningsfuld og jobrettet. Men nu har man muligheden for at fokuser pÃ¥ det man selv tror vil bringe en i arbejde og fÃ¥ hjÃ¦lp til at fÃ¥ lagt en plan der skal bringe en derhen. Det vigtigt at man som ledig gÃ¸re brug af de vÃ¦rktÃ¸jer, man tilbydes, og at man samtidig holder sig et realistisk succesmÃ¥l for Ã¸je. Hvis man tÃ¦nker at en virksomhedspraktik kan fÃ¸re til et job, bliver man nemt skuffet. Men hvis man tÃ¦nker at man fÃ¥r genopfrisket sit fagsprog, udvidet sit netvÃ¦rk og fÃ¥r en reference, sÃ¥ vil man sandsynligvis opleve en succes.  Da jobcentrene vil opleve en Ã¸get udgift til uddannelse og kurser, kan man ogsÃ¥ forvente at de vil gÃ¸re stor brug af virksomhedsrettet tilbud.   â¢	Pr 1/7: Indenfor de fÃ¸rste 6 mÃ¥neder af ens ledig, skal man til en del samtaler: 2 samtaler der skal foregÃ¥ fÃ¦lles med jobcenter og a-kassen, 2 rÃ¥dighedssamtaler hos a-kassen og 4 samtaler hos jobcentret. Det gode i det her er at ved at have fÃ¦lles mÃ¸der, hvor bÃ¥de jobcenter og a-kasse er tilstede, slipper man som ledig for at overbringe beskeder om âjamen jobcentret sagdeâ¦/Jamen a-kassen sagdeâ¦â  Ja, der vil vÃ¦re en mange mÃ¸der, og dem har man pligt til at deltage i. Men tilgengÃ¦ld kan man ogsÃ¥ hurtigere fÃ¥ sat tiltag i gang, hvis nu man har en plan allerede inden for de fÃ¸rste 6 mÃ¥neder af ens ledighed.  â¢	Pr 1/7: Tidligere skulle der gÃ¥ 9 mÃ¥neder fÃ¸r man blev aktiveret og fik hjÃ¦lp til at skrive ansÃ¸gninger, rÃ¥d og vejledning, og blev inspireret i sin jobsÃ¸gningsproces. Det betyder at man kan fÃ¥ en vurdering af hvad man kan. NÃ¥r man i mange Ã¥r har vÃ¦ret i arbejde, kan man rigtig meget, men man har ikke papir pÃ¥ det. NÃ¥r man for en realkompetencevurdering, fÃ¥r man en vurdering af hvad man kan og kan fÃ¥ det godskrevet i en uddannelse, sÃ¥ uddannelsen forkortes og sÃ¥ man kan fÃ¥ papir pÃ¥ det man kan. Er der nogen der kan hjÃ¦lpe mig med at definere begrebet Terror?  Da jeg var ung i 70âerne, hÃ¸rte jeg om terrorister. Det var Rote ArmÃ© Fraction, Bader-Meinhoff gruppen, ETA og IRA. Det var en gruppering af mennesker, som havde en ideologisk overbevisning, og som lavede et manifest. Hver gang de foretog en terrorhandling, tog gruppen âansvarâ og begrundede det udfra deres ideologi. Handlingerne var altid meget voldsomme: Bomber og mord pÃ¥ politikere.  Senere kom fx Al-Quida til. De bliver kaldt terrorister. De har ikke en ideologi, men en religionâ¦ Stadig er det en gruppe af mennesker, som tager âansvarâ for attentater.  I Frankrig og i Danmark bliver der begÃ¥et frygtelige voldshandlinger. Uskyldige bliver skudt af enkeltpersoner. Ingen gruppe stiller sig frem og tager ansvaret for skudepisoderne. Ingen ideologi bliver begrundelsen for handlingerne.   Er det terror eller er det ekstrem vold?  Hvis det drejer sig om enkeltpersoner, uden en gruppes ideologiske opbakning; burde vi sÃ¥ snakke vi psykiatri i stedet for stramning af lovgivninger, Ã¸get politiindsats eller bedre integration?  MisforstÃ¥ mig ikke. Jeg tager stor afstand til de mord, som er sket bÃ¥de her og i Frankrig. Men hvis vi skal forebygge at det sker igen, synes jeg at det er vigtigt at kalde tingene ved deres rette navn.   For kun ved at kende navnet kan man finde kuren.  SÃ¥: Er weekendens mord terror?

Og svaret er: Pest eller Kolera :-)  Hvis du kun ser pÃ¥ din og familiens sundhed, er batteridrevne lys bedst. Hvis du kun ser pÃ¥ miljÃ¸forurening, er almindelige lys bedst.  Og der er den hage ved det at batteridrevne lys kun er bedst, hvis man bruger genopladelige batterier, og sÃ¸rger for at bortskaffe dem helt korrekt.  Jeg tror ikke man kan fÃ¥ genopladelige fyrfadslys, sÃ¥ jeg mÃ¥ nok konkluderer at: Hvis jeg bruger stearin fyrfadslys (ikke parafin - Tak Peter Wade), soder det mindst muligt og sÃ¥ mÃ¥ jeg lufte godt ud. Til gengÃ¦ld er der mindre affald, og selv hvis jeg skulle komme til at sortere det forkert er miljÃ¸ pÃ¥virkningen mindre end hvis det var et batteri. Hvis jeg gerne vil bruge batteridrevne lys, skal de vÃ¦re sÃ¥ store at jeg kan fÃ¥ dem genopladet, typisk vil det krÃ¦v AA eller AAA batterier, og sÃ¥ skal jeg ogsÃ¥ lige finde en oplader. Kologh Naba Et spÃ¦ndende udviklingsprojekt i Burkina Faso, startet i 2003 af Else TrÃ¦rup. Foreningens formÃ¥l er at forbedre medlemmernes levevilkÃ¥r gennem faglig uddannelse. De 60 medlemmer af foreningen er aktive inden for fÃ¸lgende omrÃ¥der: syning, vÃ¦vning, strikning, sÃ¦befremstilling, havebrug, snedker- og murerarbejde. Foreningen har hjemme i landsbyen Saaba 15 km Ã¸st for Ouagadougou, hovedstaden i Burkina Faso.  Jeg har to gange vÃ¦ret pÃ¥ et 3 mÃ¥neders ophold i Kologh Naba, hvor jeg har hjulpet til pÃ¥ syvÃ¦rkstedet. Det var dec.-jan.-feb. 2004-05 og 2005-06. I februar i Ã¥r besÃ¸gte jeg foreningen igen efter min Mali-rejse. Der var sket store fremskridt pÃ¥ de tre Ã¥r, der er gÃ¥et siden mit sidste besÃ¸g. Fil Bleu internetbutik  Fil Bleu er et IK-udviklingsprojekt, der involverer alle led i tekstilfremstillingen fra bondens bomuld til skrÃ¦ddernes fÃ¦rdige produkter.  Alle modeller er fremstillet i vestafrikansk bomuld, vÃ¦vet og trykt i Vestafrika og syet af skrÃ¦ddere i Ouagadougou, hovedstaden i Burkina Faso. Alle varer er Fair Trade. Fil Bleu/International Kontakt (IK) er godkendt af IFAT, den internationale organisation for fair trade certificering. KINA - VERDENS FABRIK: MELLEM EN TREDJEDEL OG EN FJERDEDEL AF KINAS REKORDSTORE CO2-UDSLIP SKYLDES PRODUKTION AF VARER, DER EKSPORTERES TIL USA OG EUROPA. Kina er det land i verden, hvor vi danskere sÃ¦tter det stÃ¸rste fodaftryk. WWF Verdensnaturfonden har beregnet, at det danske fodaftryk i Kina er pÃ¥ otte millioner ton CO2, hvilket svarer til 1,5 ton CO2 pr. dansker â altsÃ¥ oven i de godt 10 ton, vi i forvejen udleder. http://big.dk/projects/zir/zir.html Great sustainable architecture by Danish Architect Bjarke Ingels. The Seven Peaks of Azerbaijan is a master plan for a Zero Energy resort and entertainment city on Zira Island situated within the Caspian Sea. Located within the crescent shaped bay of Azerbaijan's capital Baku, Zira Island is designed to be a sustainable model for urban development and an iconographic skyline recognizable from the city's coastline. The Seven Peaks of Azerbaijan proposes an architectural landscape derived from its natural landscape. The mountains are conceived not only as metaphors, but engineered as entire eco-systems, a model for future sustainable urban development.
Film: The Seven Peaks of Azerbaijan on Zira Island.  http://www.big.dk/projects/zir/zirmovie.html

"Call for PeaceWorkers  Are you a needle-worker or know someone who is? Wings of Peace International has initiated a project called Peace By Piece. People all over the world are taking pieces of fabric no larger than 12" x 12" in any direction and are using needlework to apply this message: "Imagine a world...(of. with, without) and then finish the phrase with a description of how they feel the world would be at peace."  https://www.wingsofpeaceinternational.org/get-special_events.php

The knitted garden was made by over 2000 volunteers aged 2 - 99 with a wide variety of  abilities and included families, children, choirs and WI groups, and people with learning disabilities, mental health problems, physical disability and visual impairments.  We are mainly from Bournemouth and some from across the UK with a few international participants. We even had  a lady vicar from Sunderland who knitted the mole in the hole!  http://bloomingmarvellous1.blogspot.com/

Following the trend of bringing more green space to cities like Urban Gardening, Pocket Gardens and Green Roofs, Mothership came up with the idea of the Copy Garden.  A part of a nearby park or garden is literally copied into a non-green and often cheerless place in the urban environment. In front of the photo on vinyl real plants and shrubs are placed as found in the copied park. This phenomenon is also widely used in Chinese and Japanese cities. In the first Copy Garden in Rotterdam the trail is also extended, so that it looks like you can literally go through the "park". The natural vegetation in front of the photo wall and the continued path adds to the trompe l'oeil effect.  http://www.enterthemothership.com/nggallery/page-28/album-98/gallery-297/
Brei-Graffiti in Nieuwegein, The Nederlands On an early and very cold morning of December 1, 2010 a group of women lead by Marly Weemen of Mothership in Rotterdam yarnbombed De Krul ("the curl"), a work of art in the central market square in Nieuwegein. Hundreds of smaller knittted pieces was sewn together to make up the 40 m2 to cover De Krul.

In a war someone has to die My new art projekt is called "In a war someone has to die".  A couple of years ago I happened to zap by a TV program, in which a journalist was interviewing a professional African soldier. To the soldiers great disappointment he was out of work at the moment â because there was no war in his region.  The interviewer asked the soldier if he was afraid of dying, and the soldier said: âNo I am not afraid of dying. Are you afraid of dying?â The interviewer answered: âYes I am afraid of dyingâ. Then the soldier said, without any sentimentality: âIn a war someone has to dieâ.   http://www.hannebang.com/page23/page23.html

By Andy Morgan, a freelance author and journalist based in Bristol, England: "The stakes couldn't be higher - both for Mali and West Africa as a whole. If the Islamists in Ansar ud-Dine and their quietly Machiavellian leader Iyad Ag Ghali fail to come to terms with the nationalist and secular NMLA, then the prospect is either a protracted civil war in the north or a rapid defeat of the NMLA by the better-equipped and better-funded Ansar ud-Dine and their allies in al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM).   If a deal can be reached along the lines of the protocol signed by both parties in Gao on May 26, then a new Republic of Azawad - with the word "Islamic" officially riveted to its name - will come into being. It will be governed by Sharia law and ruled by an alliance of Tuareg and Arab bigwigs, some with close and fraternal ties to the al-Qaeda emirs who have been busy kidnapping westerners, protecting drug- and people-smuggling rackets and taking on the armies of Mali, Algeria and Mauritania for the past decade." Martha Payneâs website received widespread praise and an endorsement from Jamie Oliver when it launched last month, and has since been viewed by more than 2m people. The Rolling Bridge, located on the Paddington Basin in London, was created by Thomas Heatherwick. It is twelve meters long and opens every Friday at noon. Rather than a conventional opening bridge mechanism, consisting of a single rigid element that lifts to let boats pass, the Rolling Bridge gets out of the way by curling up until its two ends touch.  http://www.kuriositas.com/2010/03/rolling-bridge-that-curls.html

Robots of Brixton Robots of Brixton is a six-minute, visually stunning political allegory, showing humanoid robots' rage against a police state. Kibwe Tavares was inspired by class riots in his hometown of Brixton, England - but he knew that by representing one group of immigrants, he'd only exclude others who faced similar hardships. "You get different cycles of different people from all over the world having the same problems," he says. The robots were his solution. http://vimeo.com/25092596

BOMBSHELLS MANIFESTO: We anonymously promote fiber craft as adventure. We aim to soften the edges of an otherwise cruel, harsh environment. We juxtapose vandalism with the non-threatening nature of fibers. We aim to readdress the nature of graffiti with a nonpermanent, nondestructive, cozy medium. If you don't like it, just unpick it. Slug Gone pure wool slug pellets are manufactured from the fleece of sheep. Wool fibres have very fine scales with small barbs on the tip called cuticle cells. These cause wool fibres to felt and matt together. Wool fibres are very hygroscopic and this plus the sand and grit already in the compound and the potassium salts from the sweat glands of the sheep absorb some of the slime from the slug's foot to cause irritation, resulting in the slug finding easier feeding methods.

Hvad er Farmer Family Learning Groups?  "Farmer Family Learning Group (FFLG) âkonceptet" blev udviklet under UlandsnetvÃ¦rkets fÃ¸devaresikkerheds-projekt i Uganda. Det bygger pÃ¥ principper om voksenuddannelse og âlearning-by-doingâ. Udgangspunktet er at enhver landmands mark er unik og at enhver landmand/kvinde er ekspert i sin egen bedrift og landbrugspraksis. I praksis er "Farmer Family Learning Group" en gruppe af landmands-husstande, som arbejder sammen og fÃ¥r hjÃ¦lp fra en facilitator til at udvikle deres bedrift og forbedre familiens levestandard og fÃ¸devaresikkerhed. De lÃ¦rer i fÃ¦llesskab og styrker derfor samtidig det lokale fÃ¦llesskab og sociale sammenhold. 
Tre smÃ¥ historier fra UlandsnetvÃ¦rkets Farmer Family Learning Groups i Uganda: Ediths gruppe finder man lidt uden for byen Kasese. Her har hver enkelt familie kun et ekstremt lille stykke land til rÃ¥dighed og derfor har gruppen fÃ¸rst og fremmest koncentreret sig om, at intensivere havernes Ã¸kosystemer. Derudover har gruppen fokuseret pÃ¥ at bygge forbedrede lerkomfurer, som sparer brÃ¦nde og hindrer at rÃ¸g generer Ã¸jnene og Ã¸delÃ¦gger lungerne. Ãn af de Ã¦ldre kvinder viser stolt sit nye lerkomfur frem og fortÃ¦ller at det blev bygget i lÃ¸bet af en eftermiddag af en af de andre kvinder i gruppen. Det har bidraget til at forbedre hendes liv meget, ligesom de grÃ¸ntsager hun nu selv er begyndt at dyrke. Hun fÃ¸ler at hun er blevet stÃ¦rkere af at spise sundere og af at vÃ¦re involveret i det fÃ¦lles arbejde sammen med de andre kvinder.

Can one book change a life?  "I thought, if a woman can do this, I am also a woman so I can also write books and do things like her. That's what motivates me."-Okanta Kate, 17  
One e-book can change a life. It changed Okanta Kate's life forever. After reading The Shark by Ghanaian author Peggy Oppong -- a book Worldreader digitized and added to her Kindle, Okanta Kate was hooked, and magical things began to happen. This 17-year-old high school student has became an avid reader, and has devoured more than 100 books in one year. She's writing poetry and short stories, and aspires to not only achieve great things, but to inspire others around her to achieve great things as well.
Over 200 million children in sub-Saharan Africa have never read a book simply due to the fact that books never make it there. One non-profit is trying to change that.  More information:  (http://www.talknerdytome.net/2012/06/1-million-e-books-to-developing.html) Worldreader.org

DO NOT PANIC!!! ;-)  How to escape from an anaconda  An excerpt from the manual for the members of the Peace Corps, working in the Amazon jungle. 1. If you are attacked by an anaconda, do not run. It still moves faster. In any case, do not panic!  2. Lie on your back. Keep your legs together and keep your arms close to the body.  3. Press your chin against the chest.  4. The snake starts to crawl upon you.  5. Do not panic.  6. Observe the snake, it will begin to swallow your feet - an anaconda always starts with the feet. Let it swallow your feet and ankles. In any case, do not panic!  7. Then the snake starts to swallow you down. It takes a lot of time and all the time you will need to lie very still. Do not Panic!  8. When the snake have swallowed your legs to the knees, begin to act - slowly, trying to make as little as possible of unnecessary movements. Pull out a knife and very gently insert it into the side of the mouth of the snake. Then flick the knife and with a swift movement cut the snake's head off.  9. Always carry a knife.  10. The knife must be sharp.   Search engine Hotels and Tickets: http://otelibileti.ru/

The Recylers In the poorest section of Paraguay's capital, residents have fashioned musical instruments from refuse they scavenged at a dump that the local community depends on for its livelihood. 
INSPIRING DREAMS ONE NOTE AT A TIME!  "Too many children in the world are born into lives with little or no hope. Landfill Harmonic reveals a mind-boggling, inventive effort to change that - musical instruments made from trash.  In the barrios of Paraguay, a humble garbage picker uses his ingenuity to craft instruments out of recycled materials - and a youth orchestra is born. Music arises and children find new dreams." Dindang natural building school is in a small village in Thailand called Paksong. The buildings at Dindang are made with a variety of natural building methods, among them bamboo wattle and daub, cob, adobe and palm thatching with decorative plaster designs, called pargeting, portraying the rainforest that surrounds the village. Unfortunately, as modern building methods were introduced in the Phato area, the traditional techniques of clay house building were largely forgotten. By setting up a natural building school, Dindang hopes to bring back the traditional building knowledge to the community to make life easy again.

For 30 years New Mexico-based architect Michael Reynolds ("The Garbage Warrior") and his green disciples have devoted their time to advancing the art of âEarthship Biotectureâ by building self-sufficient, off-the-grid communities where design and function converge in eco-harmony.  "The Simple Survival Model Earthship evolved from the very basic prototype we constructed in Haiti. The purpose of the original Haiti build was to reevaluate the concept of necessity. No matter how well the "developed world" Earthship prototypes worked, they were absolutely out of the budget of what could be achieved in Haiti. This caused us to take life itself to the basics and try to apply the globally proven Earthship concepts at a ground zero level. We succeeded... and in the end, we (the entire crew of nine) wanted to have one of these for ourselves. We wanted this unit not only because it functioned very well; but because it was very quick and inexpensive to build, thus leaving the owner with a life rather than a mortgage bondage for the next thirty years. This inspired the Simple Survival Model Earthship we are presenting here."  http://earthship.org/simple-survival
http://earthship.com/africa

"MELANESIANS OF SOLOMON ISLANDS These beautiful people are Melanesians. They come from the Solomon Islands, also known as the "black islands". It's located in the South Pacific, the very heart of Melanesia, just Northeast of Australi. They are the only black people in the world to naturally have blonde hair. "
Nordic Folkecenter for Renewable Energy in Thy is constructiing an affordable passive house. The goal is to keep the price below 10,000 DKK per m2 including VAT. Passive house is a concept that originated in Germany but is now spreading to Denmark. At the moment there are only approximately 200 passive houses in Denmark, but Folkecenter wants to support the passive house movement by building a low-cost passive house, which is fully open to the public. The architect is Per Clausen from Moeller Nielsen Architects and the craftsmen are local people. The building materials are also, when possible, local.  Follow the construction and see more images on: http://www.folkecenter.net/gb/news/fc/affordable-passivehouse/  Nordic Folkecenter for Renewable Energy on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nordiskfolkecenter
Solar Cells for Schools in Burkina Faso Nordic Folkecenter for Renewable Energy has in cooperation with Association Kologh Naba, Burkina Faso in 2013 set up solar installations at 40 schools in off grid areas of Ouagadougou, the capital of Burkina Faso.  The installations are sponsored by Merkur Bank.  Merkur Bank: https://www.merkur.dk/uk/Home/tabid/348/Default.aspx Association Kologh Naba: http://www.kologh-naba.org/index.php?lang=en See Nordic Folkecenter for more photos; http://www.folkecenter.net/gb/news/fc/PV-Light-for-15-schools-in-burkina-faso/

REFUGEE AND ENTREPRENEUR!  What to take with you when you flee? 32-year-old Marial Parmena was not in doubt. He took his solar panel on his back as he fled from the fighting in Sudsudan, and carried it more than 400 kilometers to a refugee camp in Uganda.   Now he gets 30 eurocent for charging a cell phone in the refugee camp.  He earns approx. 6 euro per day.

Buy on http://www.amazon.com/Wind-Power-World.../dp/9814364932   The books presents a cavalcade of technologies, developers, inventors and manufacturers who each gave their contribution to what took its beginning in 1975 and in the course of five to eight years, became a real modern industry. The global wind energy sector employs around one million people. Within a short time span another one million will have been added.  For the first time the world community has access to the stories behind the challenges and successes that made the ongoing energy transition possible. Some of the chapters of the wind energy books are written by my friends in their position as pioneers and scientists.
3-Story Floating School in Nigeria Rides on Recycled Barrels.  A collaborative pilot project spearheaded by NLE, a group focused on the architecture of developing cities, the Makoko Floating School is a working prototype designed to address local needs âin view of the impact of climate change and a rapidly urbanizing African context.â   Nominated for a Designs of the Year 2014 award, the structure accommodates up to 100 students and serves as a community space when school is out. Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie discusses AMERICANAH, fashion, feminism, and her bold stance against Nigeria's anti-gay laws with Michel Martin of NPR's Tell Me More. (NPR) "'I wrote it because I was angry. I was upset. It was very personal, my reaction to it. And you know, it's easy to say, 'I have people I love who are gay,' which is true, but if I didn't, I would still have been outraged by it, because I felt it was deeply unjust. And I recognize that I have a voice now in Nigeria, and so I wanted to write it, and I wanted to write it specifically for a Nigerian audience, to say, 'let's actually think about this, let's talk about this.' And the responses I got, I wasn't surprised to get ... people who said I used to love you but now that I know you support gays, I no longer love you. And when somebody told me this, that this is what her cousin had said, I said, 'tell your cousin I don't want her love, if that's the condition for her love.'"

"Binyavanga Wainaina" By Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie By the time he was 10 years old, Binyavanga Wainaina knew he was gay. But he lived in Kenya, a country that demonized homosexuality. And so for years he pretended to be what he was not. In December 2012, his friend â a fellow gay man who had also spent his life mired in pretense â got sick. Even as he lay dying, he could not tell his family that he was sick. His death broke Binyavangaâs spirit. The best-known Kenyan writer of his generation, he felt an obligation to chip away at the shame that made people like his friend die in silence. Ramial Chipped Wood (RCW) - Bois RamÃ©aux FragmentÃ©s (BRF)  Wood chips make a good mulch for woody plants. To go a step further, you want to use ramial wood chips, which are wood chips made from the outer reaches of a deciduous tree. That means the smaller branches, including the leaves if possible, and not so much the trunk and thicker branches (the rule of thumb is nothing more than 2.5 inches thick). The term ramial is based on a french word, rameal, which means ârelated to the small branchâ. It was coined by the French Canadian, Prof. Gilles Lemieux, who pioneered the research.

Den danske dokumentarfilm 'Under den samme himmel' pÃ¥ filmfestival i Burkina Faso.  For 10'ende Ã¥r i trÃ¦k afholdes filmfestivalen âCinÃ© droit libreâ i Burkina Faso. Fra 1.- 7. juni er kulturhuse, universiteter, skoler og pladser i hovedstaden omdannet til festivalomrÃ¥de. FormÃ¥let er at skabe opmÃ¦rksomhed og debat om menneskerettigheder og ytringsfrihed gennem filmmediet.  Festivalen er den stÃ¸rste filmfestival om menneskerettigheder og ytringsfrihed i Vestafrika, og den danske ambassade i Burkina Faso stÃ¸tter sammen med en lang rÃ¦kke andre donorer festivalen - herunder blandt andet âMovies that matterâ.  http://www.u-landsnyt.dk/nyhed/01-06-14/den-danske-dokumentarfilm-under-samme-himmel-p-fil
The Danish documentary  "Days of Hope" ('Under den samme himmel) to be screened at the Film Festival "Cine Droit Libre" in Burkina Faso.  For the 10th successive year the Film Festival will take place in Ouagadougou, the capital of Burkina Faso. From June 1 to 7 cultural centers, universities, schools and squares in the capital are turned into a festival area. The aim is to create awareness and debate on Human Rights and Freedom of Expression through the medium of film.  The Festival is the biggest film festival on Human Rights and Freedom of Expression in West Africa, and the Danish Embassy in Burkina Faso support along with a wide range of other donors the festival - including notably "Movies that Matter".

"9 months, 7 800 blankets. Quite an achievement!  Three Finnish organizations, Marttaliitto, Tekstiiliopettajaliitto and Novita, started their campaign in January 2011. The goal was achieved with flying colours: Finnish volunteers from all over the country, from little pupils to pensioners, made nearly 8 000 blankets! SUSTAINIA100 - 2014  SUSTAINIA100 is an annual guide to 100 innovative sustainability solutions from around the world. The guide identifies readily available projects, initiatives and technologies at the forefront of sustainable innovation. SUSTAINIA100 gives investors, business leaders, policy makers and consumers insights into promising solutions within their respective fields. These vetted projects and technologies span from Western innovation hubs to emerging economies.  http://vimeo.com/98125215
An Open Letter to Join the Fashion Revolution  On 24th April last year, 1133 people were killed and over 2500 were injured when the Rana Plaza factory complex collapsed in Dhaka, Bangladesh - social and environmental catastrophes won't stop unless we act fast.  Fashion Revolution is about building a future where an accident like the Rana Plaza factory collapse never happens again. We believe knowing who made our clothes is the first step in transforming the fashion industry. Knowing who made our clothes requires transparency, and this implies openness, honesty, communication and accountability.   Itâs about re-connecting broken links and celebrating the relationship between shoppers and the people who make our clothes, shoes, accessories and jewellery â all the things we call fashion.    The huge success of Fashion Revolution Day globally this year, with tens of thousands of people turning an item of clothing #insideout and asking brands and retailers to tell them Who Made Your Clothes? is testament of how much was done to encourage transparency throughout the supply chain. #insideout was the no. 1 trend worldwide on Twitter on 24 April.  We couldn't have done this without you; and want to continue to use your power, people power, to fund our progress for 2015. We know that we have only scratched the surface this year and if we want to be bigger, stronger and better next year (and every year) we need funds.   Your money and your donations are our independence, the only way that we can operate freely, to say what we want and do what we want.   Of course, we are calling on brands and organisations to support us, but we want to be in a position to call our supporters our "partners" and not our "sponsors". That way we can maintain our unique voice, and follow our own agenda.  We have begged and borrowed to make Fashion Revolution Day happen; our team in the UK, and all other teams worldwide, have worked tirelessly - overtime and through the night, giving time, calling on all personal networks and contacts - and everything that you have seen so far, all the amazing support, all the initiatives, every single event, was initiated by passion and commitment.  Our Global Advisory Committee have all used their means and considerable influence to help us spread the word and create change, instigating events and encouraging support.  This is the first time in history that everyone who wants to see a more sustainable future for fashion has come together, and although Fashion Revolution Day is just one day a year, the Fashion Revolution movement now needs to grow, and keep asking the questions, because we don't have the answers - yet.   Please help us to make 2015 Fashion Revolution Day even more spectacular. With your help and your donations, we will reach further and wider, independently, and consolidate the incredible momentum that we have generated so far.   https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/fashion-revolution-a-global-movement#home

"Kangas - 101 uses" by Jeannette Handby & David Bygott  This GREAT book has now been republished since 2006 with COLOUR photos, showing the different types of fabrics available, and to distinguish the Kangas from these. Kikoys - Kitenge - Pareos and Kangas are a very similar size, so this book will definitely benefit users of these other fabrics also. A few changes have been made inside the book to reflect the newer uses - for example - Kangas are now being used as COMPUTER - COVERS ! And some detail has been added about the author and artists - and the reason why and how the Book came about - very interesting ! The new publishers also altered the cover slightly to make it look different from the pirated copies that were around. The publisher is HARIASTAMP - based in Nairobi, Kenya. "Depuis le dÃ©but du projet en 2009, plus de 200 enfants ont dÃ©jÃ  pu quitter la mine de Gorol Kadje. Bien que la formation professionnelle quâils reÃ§oivent ne puisse remplacer leur absence dâÃ©ducation, elle constitue une porte de sortie pour quitter les mines. "   Since the project began in 2009, over 200 children have been able to leave the mine Gorol Kadje. Although the training they receive can not replace their lack of education, it is a door to exit the mines.  
According to a 2010 study conducted by UNICEF and the Government of Burkina Faso, almost 20,000 children were found to be working in the artisanal gold sites surveyed. However, as data on child labor is hard to obtain, it is likely that the number is significantly higher than 100,000. Many of these children work because they must help support themselves and their families. A UNICEF-supported project is helping them to get out of the mines by teaching them new vocational skills. Early-bird details of a beautiful new limited edition book We are releasing some advance information on one of the items that will appear in our next exhibition, which features a collection of jaw-droppingly beautiful unpublished portraits of Jimi Hendrix by Donald Silverstein, and starts on 26 July 2014.  Donald Silversteinâs Jimi Hendrix archive is, quite, simply, the most important previously unpublished Jimi Hendrix archive to become available on the collectors market, and we are honoured to be hosting the worldâs first exhibition of material from this classic session.  The exhibition will include a range of limited edition photographs, along with a new limited edition book. We will releasing information on the limited edition photographs next week, but now we want to give you some advance information about the book. Can You See Me? Jimi Hendrix by Donald Silverstein: The Unseen Archives is the next title from our publishing arm, Ormond Yard Press. Can You See Me? will feature over 100 previously unpublished Donald Silverstein portraits of Jimi Hendrix over its 96 pages, and is presented in our acclaimed ultra-large format, with the book measuring 24 x 18 inches when closed and 24 x 36 inches when open. Can You See Me? is being offered in a limited edition of 500 copies worldwide. Halo is a 645-square-foot group house designed by Team Sweden, a group of 25 students from Sweden's Chalmers University. It is a solar-powered house constructed with renewable materials for the group to live an energy-efficient lifestyle. Solar cells line the exterior of the living space, serving both as solar energy absorbing panels and an external roof over the structure.

DIY water pump.  "Manual system made with recycled materials based on a pulley and crank, plastic caps tied to an "endless string" of nylon or polyethylene, as well as hydraulic hoses of pvc and other simple materials that facilitate the extraction of water from a deep well without the use of electricity, gasoline or diessel and with minimal effort. The caps function as Pistons, tubes like cylinders; the pulley can be done with a bicycle wheel in disuse and crank, welding three tubes at right angles..."

WAY TO GO....!  "With the challenge using up over 5 million gallons of water so far, Damon used his challenge to shed light on some truths behind the important issues circling all the backlash. While prepping his toilet-water bucket, Damon uses the platform to dispense information: there are "800 million people in the world" who don't have access to clean drinking water, and 2.4 billion people without adequate sanitation. His choice of toilet water is an effort to highlight those themes."  "He also co-founded Water.org, a charity that focuses on solving these very issues through "affordable credit for water and sanitation improvements."  "Keep in mind," he says in his ALS video, "that the water in our toilets in the West is actually cleaner than the water that most people in the developing world have access to."  http://mic.com/articles/97344/matt-damon-s-unusual-ice-bucket-challenge-takes-on-the-campaign-s-biggest-issue?utm_source=policymicFB&utm_medium=main&utm_campaign=social  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DlGhuud-s4w

Photo: United Nations Women in Medo, Ethiopia tend to Moringa cabbage trees (Moringa Stenopetala) as part of a horticulture training project. Moringa cabbage trees are drought-resistant and are able to produce high yields even during droughts. Moringa plays a vital role for household food security, as a source of income, medicine, fodder, fuel and shade all year round.

"Alberta artist, Peter von Tiesenhausen, has effectively stopped oil corporations from putting a pipeline through his 800 acre property by covering it with artwork and copyrighting the top six inches of his land as an artwork.  Von Tiesenausen decided to talk to them in their own language: Money. The copyright claim makes his entire property a work of art since he has covered it with visual art scupltures   The copyright also drastically increases the remuneration of around $200 for lost crops to around $600,000 for an " artistic property disturbance".  Dealing with the oil tycoons as a business man, he has also been able to cut down on their harassing phone calls and visits."  http://www.dailykos.com/story/2014/05/30/1303087/-Artist-Stops-Oil-Pipeline-Cold  See Peter von Tiesenhausen's Artwork here: http://www.tiesenhausen.net/
